frameDefinitions: An Agent causes a Patient to be more strong, often resulting in something that is more secure and safe.
This frame contains nouns that refer to sensations in different modalities.
An Entity is well-known among a wide range of people (in general or in a particular domain) for a particular Reason, which may be a behavior, characteristic, or some other associated item.
A physical object, the Artifact, is produced by a Creator to stimulate the perceptions, emotions, or cognition of an audience.
Criteria exist that identify a particular Subset of a Group of things into members and non-members.
This frame describes the Impression which a Figure, which can be a person, an organization, or an object, leaves with an Audience.
frameExamples: Local Serbs are <t>strengthening</t> their grip on a narrow corridor along the Sava River between two large Serbian areas.
The huge sand dunes, perpetually changing, make for a surreal <t>sight</t>.
Shakespeare was <t>famous</t> during his life because he performed in front of Queen Elizabeth I more than anyone else.
Sir Denis Mahon is the owner of the most important private collection of Italian Baroque <t><fex name='Artifact'>paintings</fex></t>.
Urban areas have> a higher teen suicide <t><fex name='Ratio'>rate</fex></t> than rural areas.
He had an extremely fragile self - <t><fex name='Impression'>image</fex></t>
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> fortifies the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that is being made stronger.
An event which causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to become stronger.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> makes the <fen>Patient</fen> stronger.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> fortifies the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role is only expressed with certain nouns in this frame, and then only with the help of a support verb, such as <ment>have</ment>:

This is the entity or phenomenon which gives rise to the sensation. In cases of veridical sensation, this role is not typically distinguished from <fen>Percept</fen>. Most of the phrases that express this role can be paraphrased as <ment>from</ment>-phrases, e.g.

The role <fen>Percept</fen> is used for phrases that express the characteristic property of a sensation. Typically this characteristic property is described with reference to the entity or phenomenon that produces the sensation---that  is why this role can be difficult to distinguish from Source. It is possible for Source and Percept to be expressed separately, however:

This role is assigned to phrases expressing the body part in which a sensation is located. Since touch is the least localized of sense modalities, words relating to haptic sensations are the ones most likely to occur with this FE:
This role is the perceptual background against which the Phenomenon is experienced by the Perceiver.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the sensation is perceived.
The <fen>Entity</fen> which is widely known and recognized.
The behavior, attribute, or associated entities that provide the reason for the <fen>Entity</fen> being famous.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is famous.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> is famous.
This role identifies the entity or substance that is designed to have a particular <fen>Use</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Artifact</fen> is presently located.
A representation of the conditions upon which membership to a <fen>Subset</fen> of a <fen>Group</fen> is determined.
The members of a <fen>Group</fen> that fulfill particular <fen>Criteria</fen> to belong to a <fen>Subset</fen> of the <fen>Group</fen>.
The numerical representation of the size of the <fen>Subset</fen> relative to the size of the <fen>Group</fen>.
The entity (a person, organization, product, or event) for which the <fen>Audience</fen> has an <fen>Impression</fen>.
A person or group of people who have an <fen>Impression</fen> of a <fen>Figure</fen>.
A generalized conception of a <fen>Figure</fen> presented to or shared by an <fen>Audience</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> have a tingling sensation in my hands.
The smell <fex>of the garlic</fex> made me hungry.
This herb gives off a smell <fex>of garlic</fex>.
I have a tingling feeling <fex>in my hands</fex>.
This station is famous <fex>for the many ramen shacks surrounding it</fex>.
Certain people are well known <fex>only in North America</fex>.
The first of the two <fex>drawings</fex> by Parmigianino recently acquired for the National Gallery is a study for the Madonna dal collo lungo.
This drug can reduce the rate <fex>of heart diseas</fex>e significantly in people over 50.
California has a high <fex>divorce</fex> rate compared to other states.
New laws have raised crime rates <fex>by 5%</fex>
